headline: Russia's top diplomat accuses US, South Korea and Japan of preparing for war with North Korea
content: Russia's top diplomat accused the United States, South Korea and Japan on Wednesday of preparing for war with North Korea. headline: Education at all levels in China's Xinjiang is at all-time high
content:
Description: 

Summary: The China Society for Human Rights Studies on Wednesday held in Geneva a side-event on the theme of "Chinese-style Modernization and Human Rights" during the 45th session of the Working Group on the Universal Periodic Review of the UN Human Rights Council. Remina Xiaokaiti, a human rights expert at Xinjiang University, said at Wednesday's meeting that the right to education of all ethnic groups in Xinjiang has been fully guaranteed, and the unprecedented achievements in the economic and social growth there have led to the enhancement of people's happiness.

headline: Nearly 10,000 mainland talents enter Hong Kong through 'exit endorsement for talents'
content:
Description: 

Summary: Tang said in a meeting at the Legislative Council of the HKSAR that the HKSAR government has been in close discussion with the mainland on the facilitation measures to promote the "southbound and northbound" flow of high-end talents in the greater bay area. In February 2023, the mainland introduced the "southbound" exit endorsement for talents, facilitating the travel of six categories of GBA mainland talents, namely outstanding, scientific research, education, healthcare, legal and other talents to Hong Kong, Tang said.

headline: South China adopts precision measures to tackle cold snap
content:
Description: 

Summary: [Photo/Xinhua] Over the past few days, people in southern China experienced shivers as a cold snap brought heavy snowfall and sweeping blizzards across a large part of the country. The first cold snap of 2024 lasted from Saturday to Tuesday, bringing rain, heavy snow and freezing temperatures to provinces such as Hunan, Jiangxi and Guizhou.

headline: At least 9 killed in attack on UN training center in Gaza
content:
Description: 

Summary: 下载安装Flash播放器 A UN training center in Gaza's major southern city of Khan Younis was attacked and set on fire on Wednesday, killing at least nine people, a UN official said. Eyewitnesses told Xinhua that the Israeli bombing of the western areas of Khan Younis sparked a large fire at the training center.

headline: Chinese premier holds talks with PM of Antigua and Barbuda
content:
Description: 

Summary: Since the establishment of diplomatic ties 41 years ago, China and Antigua and Barbuda have always respected and supported each other, Li said, adding that China stands ready to work with Antigua and Barbuda to implement the important consensus reached by the leaders of the two countries, consolidate and carry forward the traditional friendship, continuously deepen strategic mutual trust, and enhance mutually beneficial cooperation in various fields to benefit the two countries and two peoples. Noting that both countries are developing countries, Li said China stands ready to work with Antigua and Barbuda to advance high-quality cooperation under the Belt and Road Initiative, strengthen cooperation on agriculture and infrastructure, and tap further into the potential of cooperation on the green, blue and digital economies to foster new driving forces for economic development.

headline: Legal framework has enabled successful terror crackdown
content:
Description: The prioritization in China's legal framework for preventing acts of terrorism has thwarted attacks in recent years and helped to safeguard national security and social stability, according to legal experts.

Summary: Share - WeChat CLOSE The prioritization in China's legal framework for preventing acts of terrorism has thwarted attacks in recent years and helped to safeguard national security and social stability, according to legal experts. The crimes of planning terrorist activities, advocating terrorism and extremism and inciting terrorism were added in Amendment IX to the Criminal Law adopted in August 2015, Yang said.

content:

headline: Shot 9 times at New Zealand mosque, survivor walks for peace
content:
Description: WELLINGTON: The lingering injuries from being shot nine times did not stop Temel Atacocugu from completing a two-week walk and bike ride for peace on Tuesday (Mar 15), the third anniversary of a gunman's

Summary: Atacocugu set out to retrace the gunman's 360km drive from Dunedin to the two Christchurch mosques where he carried out his attack. “I wanted to fix this damage,” Atacocugu said.

headline: Ebay to lay off 500 employees
content:
Description: E-commerce firm eBay Inc said on Tuesday it will lay off 500 employees globally, representing 4 per cent of its total workforce. Shares of the San Jose, California-based company rose about 1 per cent in aftermarket trade. "This shift gives us additional space to invest and create new roles in hig

Summary: E-commerce firm eBay Inc said on Tuesday it will lay off 500 employees globally, representing 4 per cent of its total workforce. Shares of the San Jose, California-based company rose about 1 per cent in aftermarket trade.

headline: Türkiye's parliament approves Sweden's NATO membership bid
content:
Description: ANKARA: Türkiye's parliament ratified Sweden's NATO membership bid on Tuesday (Jan 23), clearing the biggest remaining hurdle to expand the Western military alliance after 20 months of delay. Türkiye's general assembly, where President Tayyip Erdogan's ruling alliance holds a majority, voted 28

Summary: In parliament, Oktay said Erdogan's AK Party endorsed Sweden's NATO bid after its positive steps in fighting terrorism. The AKP's nationalist allies MHP and the main opposition CHP also endorsed Sweden's bid.

headline: German firms buoyant about China's growth
content:
Description: About 78 percent of German companies expect growth to be consistent in China in the next five years, while 54 percent plan to increase investments in the country, a survey published by the German Chamber of Commerce in China showed on Wednesday.

Summary: Ulf Reinhardt, chairperson of the board of the German Chamber of Commerce in China (South and Southwest China), said about 5 percent of the survey respondents currently regard Chinese companies as innovation leaders in their industry, but 46 percent foresee them becoming leaders within the next five years. The high-tech manufacturing sector has experienced rapid growth in attracting foreign investment, in line with industrial restructuring.

headline: Russia says aircraft carrying Ukrainian prisoners shot down by Ukraine
content:
Description: 

Summary: Share - WeChat CLOSE MOSCOW/KIEV -- The Russian Defense Ministry confirmed Wednesday that Ukraine launched two missiles at the Il-76 military transport aircraft, killing all 74 people on board. According to the statement, the aircraft was hit on its way from the Chkalovsky airfield to Belgorod while it was transporting Ukrainian military personnel for a prisoner exchange.

headline: Measles spreading quickly in Europe
content:
Description: 

Summary: The number of measles cases is rising because health officials across Europe are struggling to convince anti-vaccine parents to get their children immunized, according to the organization. Urgent vaccination efforts are needed to halt transmission and prevent further spread," Kluge said.

content:

headline: Economic corridor brightens Pakistan's economic future
content:
Description: The China-Pakistan Economic Corridor, a key component of the China-proposed Belt and Road Initiative, represents a monumental partnership between Pakistan and China that aims to drive economic growth and regional connectivity.

Summary: CLOSE SONG CHEN/CHINA DAILY The China-Pakistan Economic Corridor, a key component of the China-proposed Belt and Road Initiative, represents a monumental partnership between Pakistan and China that aims to drive economic growth and regional connectivity. The first phase of the CPEC stands as a transformative period in Pakistan's economic history, and it has had a profound impact on the country's infrastructure and energy landscape.

headline: Taiwan youths experience mainland development
content:
Description: About 500 young people from Taiwan are participating in a winter camp that includes Chinese customs experiences and tours of mainland provinces, aiming to boost exchanges and mutual understanding.

Summary: Share - WeChat CLOSE The opening ceremony of a winter camp for young people from Taiwan organized by the All-China Federation of Taiwan Compatriots was held at Jilin University on Wednesday. The opening ceremony organized by the All-China Federation of Taiwan Compatriots was held at Jilin University on Tuesday, and was attended by about 200 people from both sides.

headline: Texas mom Kate Cox accepts invite from Biden to attend State of the Union after she was DENIED abortion of child with trisomy 18 and forced to terminate pregnancy out of state
content:
Description: Kate Cox, 31, was denied an emergency abortion despite her baby having a life expectancy of just one week. She unsuccessfully sued the state of Texas and was forced to travel to New Mexico.

Summary: A Texas woman who was denied an emergency abortion for her baby with a rare genetic disease has accepted Biden's invitation to attend his State of the Union address. Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris and their spouses on Tuesday centered their first major campaign rally of the election year on abortion rights.

headline: Huge 100-kilo haul of meth found at Fyshwick by Australian Border Force stashed in a shipment of car radiators from the US
content:
Description: Police have uncovered a massive haul of 100kg in methamphetamine stashed inside car radiators shipping from the US.

Summary: Police have uncovered a massive haul of methamphetamine stashed inside car radiators in a major new drug bust. The huge haul of drugs - the largest ever meth bust in the ACT - was placed inside dozens of radiators in a shipment to NSW from the United States.

headline: Telling reason why Anthony Albanese suddenly appears to be smiling more - but he's also made a major gamble that could cost him later this year, writes KEVIN AIRS
content:
Description: Anthony Albanese's sudden smile highlights the sudden pivotal turning point of his leadership.

Summary: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's tax cut u-turn could be his ultimate masterstroke - if it buys the nation's forgiveness for his repeated lies that he wouldn't do it. He defended those cuts for targeting the nation's best paid 'because they pay a lot more tax' and even suggested the Coalition's plans were 'arguably insufficient'.

headline: 'That is a surprise': John Oliver compares Jon Stewart to Michael Jordan upon part-time Daily Show return, while saying the show should still appoint Roy Wood Jr or Amber Ruffin as permanent host whil
content:
Description: Former Daily Show correspondent John Oliver was stunned when he heard the news of Jon Stewart's return to the late night program and compared it to Michael Jordan's comeback.

Summary: Oliver suggested former correspondent Roy Wood Jr and ex-NBC host Amber Ruffin as potential permanent replacements, but admitted he was excited to see what Stewart will do ahead of the 2024 battle for the White House. 'I would have hired Roy Wood, or Amber Ruffin is very good, but it’s going to be very exciting to see Jon again in an election year,' Oliver added.

headline: Greg Abbott throws down the gauntlet at Biden over the border war: Texas governor says state has right to defend it self from 'lawlessness' after White House demanded agents be allowed back on the ban
content:
Description: On Wednesday afternoon, Abbott released an excoriating statement that claimed  'President Biden has violated his oath to faithfully execute immigration laws enacted by Congress '.

Summary: On Wednesday afternoon, Abbott released an excoriating statement that claimed 'President Biden has violated his oath to faithfully execute immigration laws enacted by Congress'. It also follows the Biden administration on Tuesday demanding that Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton allow federal agents to access Shelby Park in Eagle Pass where state law enforcement officers have been arresting migrants.
